thread.title: Football roundup: Unbeaten teams tough on county teams
thread.title_full: Football roundup: Unbeaten teams tough on county teams

author: David McCollum
title: Football roundup: Unbeaten teams tough on county teams
text:
Football roundup: Unbeaten teams tough on county teams Greenbrier rallies again; Mayflower stays unbeaten in conference Posted: October 9, 2015 - 10:57pm LOG CABIN STAFF WRITER 
Three Faulkner County teams played unbeaten teams Friday night. 
Things didn’t work out. Two, Conway and Vilonia, were mercy-ruled. Conway Christian lost a 2A-5 showdown at England. GREENWOOD 56, CONWAY 19 
At John McConnell Stadium, Greenwood quarterback Luke Hales connected on touchdown passes of 40, 55 and 86 yards in the first half, two of them to Ryan Padilla. The Bulldogs (6-0, 3-0) then scored on their first two possessions of the second half, including a 68-yard touchdown pass, to apply the mercy rule early in the third quarter. The Wampus Cats scored on a 64-yard run by Matthew Dail and field goals of 23 and 37 yards by Christian Underwood in the first half (one after Greenwood stopped Conway after first and goal at the 1). The Wampus Cats (3-3, 2-1) trailed 35-12 at the half. The Cats scored in the second half after the mercy rule came into effect on a 13-yard pass from Breylin Smith to Travis Thone. ENGLAND 27, CONWAY CHRISTIAN 20 
At England, the Lions (6-0, 3-0) held on for the 27-20 victory over Conway Christian (3-3, 2-1) in a contest for the conference lead. 
England, which generated 309 yards in two offense and intercepted two passes, built a 13-7 halftime lead on a 7-yard touchdown run by Zach Montgomery and a 12-yard pass from Brayden Brazeal to Darrius Clarkson that capped a 98-yard, 14-play drive. CCS scored on its first possession on a 46-yard pass from Jakob Henry to Jon Mark Wood. England took a 21-7 lead in the third quarter on a 3-yard run by Malik Coleman and added the two-point conversion. The Eagles drove 80 yards in 14 plays to draw within 21-13 late in the third quarter on a 19-yard pass from Henry to Will Jackson. Wood passed to Jackson for the conversion. The Lions put the game away on a 76-yard drive in 10 plays in the fourth quarter. Coleman scored the touchdown on a 9-yard run. Henry passed to Wood for 31 yards late in the fourth quarter. Henry completed 19 of 43 for 213 yard. Wood had 112 receiving yards. CCS was held to only 77 yards rushing. LR CHRISTIAN 40, VILONIA 23 
At Little Rock, the Warriors (6-0, 3-0) scored on three of their first six plays and used an interception return to take a 40-0 lead in the first half, invoking the mercy rule for the entire second half. The Warriors burned the Eagles (3-3, 1-2) quickly when Kyron Sanders connected with Joe Hampton of three straight touchdown passes, the first within the first 59 seconds. Hampton had receptions of 64, 34 and 56 yards. Sanders had four touchdown passes in the first half. Vilonia made the score respectable in the second half on a safety, a touchdown reception by Michael Morris and a 48-yard interception return by Morris in the final minutes. GREENBRIER 42, MAUMELLE 40 
At Maumelle, Greenbrier (4-2, 2-1), which is becoming the master of the late comeback, did it again, rallying for a 42-40 victory over the Hornets. The Panthers trailed Maumelle most of the game and 40-35 in the fourth quarter. Alex Massey’s 97-yard interception return and his 13-yard touchdown in the fourth quarter proved the difference. The Panthers had 390 yards in total offense to Maumelle’s 590. Harold Ross completed 11 of 27 passes for 230 yards and three touchdowns and added a 2-yard scoring run. Ben Wilson had 139 yards in receptions and one touchdown. Massey had five receptions for 80 yards and scored three touchdowns. MAYFLOWER 52, BARTON 22 
At Barton, the Eagles (3-3, 3-0) won their third straight conference game with the 52-22 win over Barton. Trey Ashmore completed 12 of 15 passes for 189 yards and three touchdowns and added a rushing TD. Marcus Harper rushed for 197 yards and three touchdowns and scored another on a scoop-and-score fumble return. Sean Martin had two catches for 73 yards and one touchdown. He intercepted two passes. JW Estes had four catches for 47 yards and a touchdown. Christian Forrester rushed for 67 yards and had two catches for 41 yards and a TD. Aaron Mason had number tackles and forced a fumble. Sean Harris added nine tackles. The Eagles had 419 yards in offense and forced four turnovers.
